id: Movie theater chain encourages employees to vote by opening late on election day
paragraph: Alamo Drafthouse Cinema, a Texas-based movie theater chain, announced Tuesday that it its theaters will open late on Nov. 6 in an effort to encourage voter participation in the midterm elections slated for that day."The most important midterm election anyone can remember is next Tuesday, November 6th, so we're making sure our venue staff has the opportunity to cast their ballot by skipping our usual first round of early matinees that day. We’ll fire the projectors up later on in the afternoon," the company said in a statement. Tim League, the Alamo Drafthouse founder and CEO, told Entertainment Weekly that the company is also offering to pay for any rideshare trips that staff members take on election day to polling locations."My mom instilled in me at a young age the importance of voting in every election, and I try to pay that forward with the staff at Alamo,” League said. The movie theater chain has locations across the United States, including nearly two dozen in Texas.Voters across Texas will get to vote in one of the country's most high-profile Senate races between incumbent Sen.
